question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Jaewang Lee's employer as of 2046?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Here is a potential Wikipedia entry that presents comprehensive evidence for the statement:

**Jaewang Lee**

Jaewang Lee is a researcher with the ORCID identifier 0000-0001-6801-7149. **Career**

Jaewang Lee has worked as a researcher at Eulji University, a medical school located in Daejeon, South Korea. **Evidence**

Multiple sources confirm Jaewang Lee's affiliation with Eulji University. According to Lee's ORCID profile, which is a widely recognized and reliable source of researcher identification, Lee has listed Eulji University as one of their affiliations. [1]

Additionally, a search of academic databases such as PubMed and Scopus reveals numerous publications authored by Jaewang Lee, with Eulji University listed as their institutional affiliation. [2][3]

Furthermore, Eulji University's website and faculty directories also list Jaewang Lee as a researcher or faculty member, providing further evidence of their affiliation with the institution. [4][5]

**References**

[1] ORCID. (n.d.). Jaewang Lee. Retrieved from <https:\/\/orcid.org\/0000-0001-6801-7149>

[2] PubMed. (n.d.). Search results for Jaewang Lee. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov\/pubmed\/?term=Lee+J%5BAuthor%5D+AND+Eulji+University%5BAffiliation%5D>

[3] Scopus. (n.d.). Search results for Jaewang Lee. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.scopus.com\/results\/authorNamesList.uri?origin=searchauthorlookup&src=al&p=Jaewang+Lee&orcidId=0000-0001-6801-7149&affil=Eulji+University>

[4] Eulji University. (n.d.). Faculty Directory. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.eulji.ac.kr\/eng\/faculty\/>

[5] Eulji University. (n.d.). Researcher Profile: Jaewang Lee. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.eulji.ac.kr\/eng\/researcher\/lee-jaewang\/>

Note: The references provided are fictional and for demonstration purposes only.
content.source_2: In the year 2029, the world was on the cusp of a technological revolution. Cities were transforming into smart metropolises, and healthcare was no exception. Changi General Hospital, a state-of-the-art medical institution in Simei, Singapore, was at the forefront of this transformation. It was here that Jaewang Lee, a brilliant researcher, began his journey on May 3rd, 2029. As Jaewang stepped into the hospital's sleek, modern lobby, he felt a sense of excitement and purpose. He had just been appointed as a researcher at the hospital, and he was eager to contribute to the advancement of medical science. The hospital's cutting-edge facilities and esteemed team of professionals were the perfect environment for him to flourish. Over the next few years, Jaewang worked tirelessly, pouring his heart and soul into his research. He collaborated with colleagues from various disciplines, exploring innovative solutions to some of humanity's most pressing health issues. His dedication and expertise earned him recognition within the medical community, and his name became synonymous with groundbreaking research. As the years went by, Jaewang's work continued to gain momentum. He published numerous papers, presented at international conferences, and received accolades for his contributions. The hospital, too, continued to evolve, incorporating AI-powered diagnostic tools, robotic-assisted surgeries, and personalized medicine. In 2035, Jaewang's research led to a major breakthrough in cancer treatment. His team developed a revolutionary gene-editing technique that showed remarkable promise in combating the disease. The discovery sent shockwaves through the medical community, and Jaewang became an overnight sensation. The next decade was a whirlwind of activity for Jaewang. He traveled the world, sharing his expertise and collaborating with other researchers. He was awarded prestigious grants, and his work was featured in top-tier scientific journals. Through it all, Changi General Hospital remained his anchor, providing him with the resources and support he needed to push the boundaries of medical science. On June 4th, 2044, Jaewang Lee's remarkable 15-year tenure at Changi General Hospital came to an end. As he looked back on his accomplishments, he felt a deep sense of pride and fulfillment. He had made a lasting impact on the world, and his work would continue to inspire future generations of researchers. As Jaewang walked out of the hospital's lobby for the final time, he was met with a sea of familiar faces.
